Like most have said before,  Barcelona does not have a shortage of "tapas" places to choose from and most being tourist traps at best,  but this little hidden gem off the beaten path was a welcome surprise. Somewhat inconspicuous in its locale, as are often some of the best places to eat at,  the experience here did not disappoint. The flavors within the dishes were superb.  We had patatas bravas (cooked to a slight crisp with an amazing sauce drizzled over them),  fried calamari (typical but still very good) and the salteado,  which was heavenly. You will not be disappointed at all. And the prices were fair to boot!
